Business Information: Children’s of Alabama has provided specialized medical care for ill and injured children across the state and throughout the southeastern U.S. since 1911. For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Street Address: 1600 7th Ave South  Uab Pediatric Surgery Jfl 300

Business Information: Children’s of Alabama has provided specialized medical care for ill and injured children across the state and throughout the southeastern U.S. since 1911. For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Business Information: Children’s of Alabama has provided specialized medical care for ill and injured children across the state and throughout the southeastern U.S. since 1911. For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Business Information: Our office is proud to offer expert care for infants, children and teens. We offer a patient-friendly, warm and welcoming environment that helps you and your child look forward to each visit. We hope to have a positive impact on the lives of our patients and their families by providing exceptional care with compassionate service.
Welcome to Birmingham Pediatric Associates! We are a pediatric practice in Birmingham, AL. We look forward to serving your family!

Established in 1989, Growing Up Pediatrics is a medical center that provides health care services for children. It serves the Bessemer and Inverness areas in Alabama. The center s health maintenance services include newborn and baby care, developmental checkups, physical examinations and immunizations, as well as nutritional, sex education and family counseling. Growing Up Pediatrics also offers acute care services for cold, flu, sore throat, ear infection, bronchitis, pneumonia, and minor lacerations and burns. It additionally provides skin care and allergy testing and management services. The center offers emergency services for high fever, breathing difficulty, seizures, poisoning and severe allergic reactions. Growing Up Pediatrics maintains a staff of several doctors and nurses. The center maintains two locations in Birmingham, Ala.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Children’s of Alabama has provided specialized medical care for ill and injured children across the state and throughout the southeastern U.S. since 1911. For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Business Information: Our office is proud to offer expert care for infants, children and teens. We offer a patient-friendly, warm and welcoming environment that helps you and your child look forward to each visit. We hope to have a positive impact on the lives of our patients and their families by providing exceptional care with compassionate service.
Welcome to Birmingham Pediatric Associates! We are a pediatric practice in Birmingham, AL. We look forward to serving your family!

Established in 1989, Growing Up Pediatrics is a medical center that provides health care services for children. It serves the Bessemer and Inverness areas in Alabama. The center s health maintenance services include newborn and baby care, developmental checkups, physical examinations and immunizations, as well as nutritional, sex education and family counseling. Growing Up Pediatrics also offers acute care services for cold, flu, sore throat, ear infection, bronchitis, pneumonia, and minor lacerations and burns. It additionally provides skin care and allergy testing and management services. The center offers emergency services for high fever, breathing difficulty, seizures, poisoning and severe allergic reactions. Growing Up Pediatrics maintains a staff of several doctors and nurses. The center maintains two locations in Birmingham, Ala.
Specializing in Gynecology and Weight Loss Control.

Total Skin & Beauty Dermatology Center is a full-service clinic to treat skin disease. Based in Birmingham, Ala., the clinic comprises the medical center, the surgical center, the phototherapy center, the aesthetic center for cosmetic and laser surgery and the research center. The firm carry a wide assortment of skin care products, such as La Roche-Posay Toleriane soothing protective care, La Roche-Posay Hydraphase Riche, nutritic emulsion 2.5%, elta MD moisturizer, elta MD ultra violet daily sun protection formula 40 and many more.

OrthoSports Associates provides orthopedic care at the highest standard. We offer our patients one-on-one care in modern, state-of-the-art facilities. Our team of physicians work with you to determine the best, most conservative treatment approach and assist you in seeking a treatment plan that maintains your independence, dignity and a maximum level of function. With international training, institutional-level experience, and a multitude of publications, our doctors bring world-class expertise to the Greater Birmingham area.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Business Name: Children's of Alabama - Pediatric ENT Associates
Business Information: Pediatric ENT Associates is a group of doctors that specialize in diagnosis and treatment of pediatric ear, nose, and throat conditions. Our doctors use the Children's of Alabama hospital as an outpatient center. From obstructive sleep apnea to hearing loss, our physicians have the experience and skills to diagnose and develop the best individual treatment plan for your child. If you have any questions for Pediatric ENT Associates, please contact our expert staff today.

The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a medical facility that offers diagnosis and treatment services for cancer. It provides an array of patient care services, including radiation treatment, infusion therapy and plastic surgery. The clinic also offers ear, nose and throat related, head and neck surgery, surgical oncology and urology services. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road additionally provides obstetric services for mothers who have diabetes, high blood pressure, Rh problems, and heart, lung, kidney and vascular diseases. It maintains an on-site laboratory. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a member of the UAB Health System, which operates several hospitals and clinics in Alabama. The clinic is located in Birmingham, Ala.

Children’s of Alabama has provided specialized medical care for ill and injured children across the state and throughout the southeastern U.S. since 1911. For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Dr. Swetha Geetha S Pinninti, MD
Dr. Elizabeth A Beierle Chen, MD

Business Information: Our office is proud to offer expert care for infants, children and teens. We offer a patient-friendly, warm and welcoming environment that helps you and your child look forward to each visit. We hope to have a positive impact on the lives of our patients and their families by providing exceptional care with compassionate service.
Welcome to Birmingham Pediatric Associates! We are a pediatric practice in Birmingham, AL. We look forward to serving your family!

Established in 1989, Growing Up Pediatrics is a medical center that provides health care services for children. It serves the Bessemer and Inverness areas in Alabama. The center s health maintenance services include newborn and baby care, developmental checkups, physical examinations and immunizations, as well as nutritional, sex education and family counseling. Growing Up Pediatrics also offers acute care services for cold, flu, sore throat, ear infection, bronchitis, pneumonia, and minor lacerations and burns. It additionally provides skin care and allergy testing and management services. The center offers emergency services for high fever, breathing difficulty, seizures, poisoning and severe allergic reactions. Growing Up Pediatrics maintains a staff of several doctors and nurses. The center maintains two locations in Birmingham, Ala.
Specializing in Gynecology and Weight Loss Control.

Total Skin & Beauty Dermatology Center is a full-service clinic to treat skin disease. Based in Birmingham, Ala., the clinic comprises the medical center, the surgical center, the phototherapy center, the aesthetic center for cosmetic and laser surgery and the research center. The firm carry a wide assortment of skin care products, such as La Roche-Posay Toleriane soothing protective care, La Roche-Posay Hydraphase Riche, nutritic emulsion 2.5%, elta MD moisturizer, elta MD ultra violet daily sun protection formula 40 and many more.

OrthoSports Associates provides orthopedic care at the highest standard. We offer our patients one-on-one care in modern, state-of-the-art facilities. Our team of physicians work with you to determine the best, most conservative treatment approach and assist you in seeking a treatment plan that maintains your independence, dignity and a maximum level of function. With international training, institutional-level experience, and a multitude of publications, our doctors bring world-class expertise to the Greater Birmingham area.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Business Name: Children's of Alabama - Pediatric ENT Associates
Business Information: Pediatric ENT Associates is a group of doctors that specialize in diagnosis and treatment of pediatric ear, nose, and throat conditions. Our doctors use the Children's of Alabama hospital as an outpatient center. From obstructive sleep apnea to hearing loss, our physicians have the experience and skills to diagnose and develop the best individual treatment plan for your child. If you have any questions for Pediatric ENT Associates, please contact our expert staff today.

The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a medical facility that offers diagnosis and treatment services for cancer. It provides an array of patient care services, including radiation treatment, infusion therapy and plastic surgery. The clinic also offers ear, nose and throat related, head and neck surgery, surgical oncology and urology services. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road additionally provides obstetric services for mothers who have diabetes, high blood pressure, Rh problems, and heart, lung, kidney and vascular diseases. It maintains an on-site laboratory. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a member of the UAB Health System, which operates several hospitals and clinics in Alabama. The clinic is located in Birmingham, Ala.

For the past three years, Children’s has been ranked among the best children’s hospital programs in the nation by US News & World Report. Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Business Information: Our office is proud to offer expert care for infants, children and teens. We offer a patient-friendly, warm and welcoming environment that helps you and your child look forward to each visit. We hope to have a positive impact on the lives of our patients and their families by providing exceptional care with compassionate service.
Welcome to Birmingham Pediatric Associates! We are a pediatric practice in Birmingham, AL. We look forward to serving your family!

Established in 1989, Growing Up Pediatrics is a medical center that provides health care services for children. It serves the Bessemer and Inverness areas in Alabama. The center s health maintenance services include newborn and baby care, developmental checkups, physical examinations and immunizations, as well as nutritional, sex education and family counseling. Growing Up Pediatrics also offers acute care services for cold, flu, sore throat, ear infection, bronchitis, pneumonia, and minor lacerations and burns. It additionally provides skin care and allergy testing and management services. The center offers emergency services for high fever, breathing difficulty, seizures, poisoning and severe allergic reactions. Growing Up Pediatrics maintains a staff of several doctors and nurses. The center maintains two locations in Birmingham, Ala.
Specializing in Gynecology and Weight Loss Control.

Total Skin & Beauty Dermatology Center is a full-service clinic to treat skin disease. Based in Birmingham, Ala., the clinic comprises the medical center, the surgical center, the phototherapy center, the aesthetic center for cosmetic and laser surgery and the research center. The firm carry a wide assortment of skin care products, such as La Roche-Posay Toleriane soothing protective care, La Roche-Posay Hydraphase Riche, nutritic emulsion 2.5%, elta MD moisturizer, elta MD ultra violet daily sun protection formula 40 and many more.

OrthoSports Associates provides orthopedic care at the highest standard. We offer our patients one-on-one care in modern, state-of-the-art facilities. Our team of physicians work with you to determine the best, most conservative treatment approach and assist you in seeking a treatment plan that maintains your independence, dignity and a maximum level of function. With international training, institutional-level experience, and a multitude of publications, our doctors bring world-class expertise to the Greater Birmingham area.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Business Name: Children's of Alabama - Pediatric ENT Associates
Business Information: Pediatric ENT Associates is a group of doctors that specialize in diagnosis and treatment of pediatric ear, nose, and throat conditions. Our doctors use the Children's of Alabama hospital as an outpatient center. From obstructive sleep apnea to hearing loss, our physicians have the experience and skills to diagnose and develop the best individual treatment plan for your child. If you have any questions for Pediatric ENT Associates, please contact our expert staff today.

The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a medical facility that offers diagnosis and treatment services for cancer. It provides an array of patient care services, including radiation treatment, infusion therapy and plastic surgery. The clinic also offers ear, nose and throat related, head and neck surgery, surgical oncology and urology services. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road additionally provides obstetric services for mothers who have diabetes, high blood pressure, Rh problems, and heart, lung, kidney and vascular diseases. It maintains an on-site laboratory. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a member of the UAB Health System, which operates several hospitals and clinics in Alabama. The clinic is located in Birmingham, Ala.

Alabama Orthopaedic Center has dedicated itself to provide you and those you love with the best orthopaedic treatment. All of our surgeons are trained to offer the highest in medical expertise. The staff at Alabama Orthopedic Center is professional, efficient and welcoming. We know that your health involves you and your family, so we take the time to listen and discuss your treatment options in detail.

At Children's Medical Group, our skilled team of Birmingham pediatricians offers comprehensive medical care for infants, children, and adolescents. Conveniently located in the heart of Birmingham, our courteous and knowledgeable staff works hard from the first contact to make every visit to our office positive.

Redmont Pediatric Associates, P.C. , founded in 1992, offers physicians with an extensive background in caring for children, from newborn through their teen years. We know how important it is to trust your doctor and their staff, so we work with you and for you, to accomodate your needs, answer any questions or concerns you may have and make you feel at home.

Welcome to Pediatric Dental Associates! Welcome to the website of Pediatric Dental Associates, with five convenient locations in Birmingham, Cullman, Hoover, Oxford, and Pell City, Alabama. At Pediatric Dental Associates, excellence in patient care is our number one priority. We pride ourselves on providing high quality dental care to our patients, and with years of experience working with kids, our pediatric dentists and seasoned team of pediatric dental expert staff know how to make every trip to our office fun and enjoyable for the whole family. Thank you for your interest in our practice. We hope to see you soon at Pediatric Dental Associates!

Dr. Winkler graduated from Milligan College in 1984 with a B.S. degree in Biology and Mathematics. She went on to obtain a Masters Degree in Mathematics from the University of South Carolina in 1986 and subsequently taught college mathematics. She then attended medical school at the University of South Carolina and completed her MD degree in 1991. Dr. Winkler completed her internship and residency at the University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences in 1994. She subsequently went on to pursue training in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. She completed this training in 1997 and moved to Lexington, Kentucky where she was an Assistant Professor in Pediatric Critical Care Medicine from 1997 – 2000. In 2000 Dr. Winkler returned to Birmingham and went on to lead the Pediatric Critical Care Division at the Children’s Hospital of Alabama. She is board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. She is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics and a Fellow of the Society for Critical Care Medicine. She loves living in Birmingham and is excited about joining Southlake Pediatrics as she transitions into the primary care setting for the next phase of her career.

Dr. Wamack joined Birmingham Pediatrics in 1990 after completing his residency at Vanderbilt University Childrenâ??s Hospital, where he was Chief Resident, 1989-1990. In addition to his practice, he has served as Chief of Services for the Department of Pediatrics at St. Vincentâ??s Hospital since 2001. Prior to residency, he attended high school locally at Vestavia Hills High School, graduated with honors from Harding University majoring in Chemistry, and attended medical school at The University of Alabama School of Medicine in Birmingham. He is board-certified in pediatrics and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Pediatrics. He and his wife Jeanne live in Vestavia Hills and have two children, Hunter and Catherine.

Last year, patients made more than 634,000 outpatient and nearly 14,000 inpatient visits to Children’s from every county in Alabama and from 47 other states. With more than 2 million square feet, it is the third largest pediatric medical facility in the U.S. Children’s offers inpatient and outpatient services across its Russell Campus on Birmingham’s historic Southside with additional outpatient services provided at Children’s South and Children’s on 3rd. Primary care is provided at more than a dozen medical offices in communities across central Alabama. Children’s of Alabama is the only medical center in Alabama dedicated solely to the care and treatment of children. It is a private, not-for-profit medical center that serves as the primary site of the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB) pediatric medicine, surgery, research and residency programs. Children’s recently moved much of its inpatient services into a new building named The Benjamin Russell Hospital for Children.

Business Information: Our office is proud to offer expert care for infants, children and teens. We offer a patient-friendly, warm and welcoming environment that helps you and your child look forward to each visit. We hope to have a positive impact on the lives of our patients and their families by providing exceptional care with compassionate service.
Welcome to Birmingham Pediatric Associates! We are a pediatric practice in Birmingham, AL. We look forward to serving your family!

Established in 1989, Growing Up Pediatrics is a medical center that provides health care services for children. It serves the Bessemer and Inverness areas in Alabama. The center s health maintenance services include newborn and baby care, developmental checkups, physical examinations and immunizations, as well as nutritional, sex education and family counseling. Growing Up Pediatrics also offers acute care services for cold, flu, sore throat, ear infection, bronchitis, pneumonia, and minor lacerations and burns. It additionally provides skin care and allergy testing and management services. The center offers emergency services for high fever, breathing difficulty, seizures, poisoning and severe allergic reactions. Growing Up Pediatrics maintains a staff of several doctors and nurses. The center maintains two locations in Birmingham, Ala.
Specializing in Gynecology and Weight Loss Control.

Total Skin & Beauty Dermatology Center is a full-service clinic to treat skin disease. Based in Birmingham, Ala., the clinic comprises the medical center, the surgical center, the phototherapy center, the aesthetic center for cosmetic and laser surgery and the research center. The firm carry a wide assortment of skin care products, such as La Roche-Posay Toleriane soothing protective care, La Roche-Posay Hydraphase Riche, nutritic emulsion 2.5%, elta MD moisturizer, elta MD ultra violet daily sun protection formula 40 and many more.

OrthoSports Associates provides orthopedic care at the highest standard. We offer our patients one-on-one care in modern, state-of-the-art facilities. Our team of physicians work with you to determine the best, most conservative treatment approach and assist you in seeking a treatment plan that maintains your independence, dignity and a maximum level of function. With international training, institutional-level experience, and a multitude of publications, our doctors bring world-class expertise to the Greater Birmingham area.

Dr. VicinanzoÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢s practice encompasses reconstructive and cosmetic surgery of the orbits, eyelids, brows, and lacrimal system due to trauma, cancer, congenital defects, systemic diseases, and aging. He received his undergraduate degree with honors from Harvard University and his medical degree with honors from the Syracuse College of Medicine at the State University of New York. His specialty training in ophthalmology was done at Vanderbilt University, followed by a 2 year ASOPRS fellowship in oculoplastic, orbital, and reconstructive surgery at UAB Medical Center and The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital. Dr. Vicinanzo serves as an Assistant Clinical Professor for the Department of Ophthalmology at UAB, where he actively teaches oculoplastic surgery to the resident doctors at The Callahan Eye Foundation Hospital, the Birmingham VA Hospital, and UAB Medial Center. He is a member and he serves as an associate preceptor for The American Society of Oculoplastics and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS) in the training of certified fellows. Dr. Vicinanzo is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology and is a diplomat of the American Academy of Ophthalmology. He is currently involved in multiple eye and oculplastic research studies. Dr. Vicinanzo was elected to Best Doctors in America in 2009. For patientsÃƒÂ¢Ã¢"šÂ¬Ã¢"žÂ¢ convenience, Dr. Vicinanzo is now seeing patients at our satellite offices in Huntsville and Montgomery. All appointments for these offices can be made through our main office in Birmingham.

John A. Long has practiced oculoplastic surgery in Birmingham since 1988. His practice is limited to cosmetic and reconstructive surgery of the eyelids, orbits and lacrimal system. Dr. Long received his medical degree from the University of Iowa in 1983 and completed his internship in Wisconsin. Specialty training in ophthalmology was done at the University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA). Following the completion of his residency in 1987, Dr. Long completed a fellowship in oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery at UCLA. Dr. Long is active in both the practice of oculoplastic surgery and the teaching of the art and science of his subspecialty at the University of Alabama at Birmingham. He is an Associate Clinical Professor of Ophthalmology at UAB and participates in the training of ophthalmologists. Dr. Long serves as one of the preceptors for a fellowship sponsored by the American Society of Ophthalmic and Reconstructive Surgery (ASOPRS). The current fellow is Shannon G. Cox, M.D. Dr. Long has recently published a book on oculoplastic surgery. He has written numerous papers, published chapters and has given talks around the world on various topics in oculoplastic surgery. Dr. Long is certified by the American Board of Ophthalmology, is a member of the American Society of Oculoplastic and Reconstructive Surgery, American Society of Cosmetic Surgery and a Fellow of the American College of Surgeons. Dr. Long has been elected to Best Doctors in America for many years in a row. Dr. Long is a leader in the field of oculoplastic and reconstructive surgery. Visit his website at www.eyelid-doc.com.

Business Name: Children's of Alabama - Pediatric ENT Associates
Business Information: Pediatric ENT Associates is a group of doctors that specialize in diagnosis and treatment of pediatric ear, nose, and throat conditions. Our doctors use the Children's of Alabama hospital as an outpatient center. From obstructive sleep apnea to hearing loss, our physicians have the experience and skills to diagnose and develop the best individual treatment plan for your child. If you have any questions for Pediatric ENT Associates, please contact our expert staff today.

The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a medical facility that offers diagnosis and treatment services for cancer. It provides an array of patient care services, including radiation treatment, infusion therapy and plastic surgery. The clinic also offers ear, nose and throat related, head and neck surgery, surgical oncology and urology services. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road additionally provides obstetric services for mothers who have diabetes, high blood pressure, Rh problems, and heart, lung, kidney and vascular diseases. It maintains an on-site laboratory. The Kirklin Clinic at Acton Road is a member of the UAB Health System, which operates several hospitals and clinics in Alabama. The clinic is located in Birmingham, Ala.
